page.title: 08The wool trade
page.content: Wool was very important to England and particularly the Cotswolds.We had more wool than we wanted so we exported it. Every year shearing was done. It was always a very important time of year for the sheep owners in the Cotwolds. Merchants would buy the wool before it was shorn so nobody else would get it. So they were taking a risk if the wool was not very good but it was usually good.Some times people from{France, {Lombards and Flemings}came to buy the wool. Why does the Lord Chancellor sit on a sheeps wool sack and not on the lovely seats like every one else? The reason is that the wool sack stands for the wool trade which shows wool was very important for the country.
